alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Clay; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:25AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Jefferson, Stephens, southern Cotton, northwestern Carter, northern Clay, northern Archer, Wichita, southeastern Wilbarger and northeastern Baylor Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 324 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from a line of showers along a line extending from 4 miles south of Bray to 3 miles north of Lake Diversion. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 mph from the north or northwest. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Duncan, Burkburnett, Waurika, Archer City, Iowa Park, Holliday, Comanche, Temple, Ryan, Petrolia, Velma, Byers, Dean, Randlett, Jolly, Tatums, Hastings, Loco, and Ratliff City. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This wind shift will affect fire fighting efforts. Please advise fire crews in the field of the change in wind direction. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
